channel.title: Need help-(server went down for no reason)
channel.description:
Hey could anybody help me solve my problem?
I was on the server earlier this morning and now nobody can get on, I can't even get on...
[u]I Already Tried:[/u] Making sure the client was on my IP Using a different Run.bat Using a different server Re-Portforwarding

item.title: Need help-(server went down for no reason)
item.dc:creator: @dude08 dude08
item.description:
@dude08 wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

fixed it… had to add my DMZ to my router and my Static ip

Yo can you help me through TV?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help-(server went down for no reason)
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“yo dude 1345, post:18, topic:398489”]zomg I know then ok ok. Listen very carefully. I had this problem with my server before. go download another source RSPS source that is and then run that source. once it says its online go to www.google.com and go to the status checker and check to see if you’re online. If you are then switch back to your other source, your original one that is. Now your server should be online if not then keep trying to run the source you just downloaded and then keep switching back to your original. Eventually this will get your original source/server back online. If not then I am more then willing to team viewer with anyone.[/quote]The only thing that is bugging me is that its the UDP Port. Utorrent unblocks the Incoming for me and its open but my server runs on 43594 and so does Utorrent and i don’t feel like changing the whole client around. So if you can help me figure out what is blocking my incoming connection (UDP port) i will TV you. My TCP works so idk…

Read full topic
item.source: Need help-(server went down for no reason)

item.title: Need help-(server went down for no reason)
item.dc:creator: @yo_dude_1345 yo dude 1345
item.description:
@yo_dude_1345 wrote:

zomg I know then ok ok. Listen very carefully. I had this problem with my server before. go download another source RSPS source that is and then run that source. once it says its online go to www.runelocus.com and go to the status checker and check to see if you’re online. If you are then switch back to your other source, your original one that is. Now your server should be online if not then keep trying to run the source you just downloaded and then keep switching back to your original. Eventually this will get your original source/server back online. If not then I am more then willing to team viewer with anyone.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help-(server went down for no reason)

item.title: Need help-(server went down for no reason)
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“yo dude 1345, post:13, topic:398489”]Ok here’s what you got to do to get your “servers” back online. First go to your modem/router and reset it. By reset I mean press the tiny little button on the sides or back of the modem. Then wait for your internet to come back on. Now you must delete both the udp and the tcp from the firewall exceptions and re-add them. Now you must portforward again and then all you have to do is run your server! Congratz it should be online now!

Edit----

If you want to see if your port is open or not go to this page

http://portforward.com/help/portcheck.htm

download the software and then check to see if your port is open.

Also canyouseeme.org is not a good site to check your ports. Also if anyone is still having trouble getting there server online again I will help via team viewer. Team viewer is a soft ware that would allow me to see your screen plus interact with it.[/quote]Did not help. Thanks for trying though.

Read full topic

By reset I mean press the tiny little button on the sides or back of the modem. Then wait for your internet to come back on. Now you must delete both the udp and the tcp from the firewall exceptions and re-add them. Now you must portforward again and then all you have to do is run your server! Congratz it should be online now!

Uhmm I don’t think this is the problem, because I cant even get on.

Also canyouseeme.org is not a good site to check your ports. Also if anyone is still having trouble getting there server online again I will help via team viewer. Team viewer is a soft ware that would allow me to see your screen plus interact with it.[/quote]

item.source: Need help-(server went down for no reason)

item.title: Need help-(server went down for no reason)
item.dc:creator: @yo_dude_1345 yo dude 1345
item.description:
@yo_dude_1345 wrote:

Ok here’s what you got to do to get your “servers” back online. First go to your modem/router and reset it. By reset I mean press the tiny little button on the sides or back of the modem. Then wait for your internet to come back on. Now you must delete both the udp and the tcp from the firewall exceptions and re-add them. Now you must portforward again and then all you have to do is run your server! Congratz it should be online now!

Edit----

If you want to see if your port is open or not go to this page

http://portforward.com/help/portcheck.htm

download the software and then check to see if your port is open.

Also canyouseeme.org is not a good site to check your ports. Also if anyone is still having trouble getting there server online again I will help via team viewer. Team viewer is a soft ware that would allow me to see your screen plus interact with it.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help-(server went down for no reason)

item.title: Need help-(server went down for no reason)
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

When I used Canyouseeme.org, it says Error: I could not see your service on***.***.***.*** on port (43594)
Reason: Connection refused. This means my port is open, but something is blocking it. Which dosen’t make sense because my firewall is off, Utorrent is off, and my Antivirus doesen’t have a firewall…

Read full topic
